image.altText: A black silhouette of an anonymous interviewee.

props.synopsis: Survivors and lawyers welcome the nation-leading legislation, with legal action against churches, sporting groups and others to be affected.

title.children: ACT closes 'legal loophole' making institutions more liable for child sexual abuse

image.altText: Man in suit and sunglasses beside a woman in a suit jacket and pink shirt wearing sunglasses.

props.synopsis: A woman who used credit cards from the childcare centre where she worked to purchase personal clothes and cosmetics has been sentenced to jail.

title.children: Woman jailed for $300,000 childcare centre fraud

image.altText: A bus and a politician

props.synopsis: Investigators and users say the ACT government's MyWay+ project was rushed and flawed.

title.children: Minister censured over 'user-hateful' public transport upgrades

image.altText: A batsman wearing blue swings the bat as a wicketkeeper wearing green lunges

props.synopsis: India is left frustrated after rain washed out the men's T20I series opener against Australia at a cold and dreary Manuka Oval.

title.children: Rain washes out first Australia—India T20I in Canberra

image.altText: A Virgin plan on the tarmac.

props.synopsis: A man who drove through the airport's perimeter fence three times in 2023 has been sentenced in the ACT Supreme Court.

title.children: Man jailed over theft of Virgin van driven on Canberra Airport tarmac

image.altText: ACT Liberals leader Leanne Castley

props.synopsis: When approached by the ABC this morning, Canberra Liberals leader Leanne Castley would not provide an explanation for why two backbenchers were removed from the party room but insisted they were allowed to cross the floor.

title.children: Castley refuses to explain why backbenchers removed from party room

image.altText: An exterior of a Canberra school.

props.synopsis: The man is warned that he came close to being remanded in custody, with the magistrate saying he is on a "knife-edge".

title.children: Canberra father allegedly threatens daughter and friends with axe outside school

image.altText: White power drug, sprinkled on reflective surface, with ziplock plastic bag.

props.synopsis: Advocates say since the ACT decriminalised "personal use" amounts of some illicit drugs, the territory has seen a shift toward meaningful harm reduction, but others are calling for those laws to be repealed, saying they are not working as intended.

title.children: ACT 'beginning to see change' two years on from drug decriminalisation

image.altText: A red children's truck sits in front of some other toys on a floor.

props.synopsis: A Four Corners investigation reveals there are more childcare workers convicted or accused of sexual assault than the public has previously understood, including in the ACT.

title.children: Parents not told daughter's childcare teacher was a sex offender

image.altText: A smiling teenager with cricket pictures in the background

props.synopsis: The family of Ben Austin, who died after being struck by a ball during cricket practice in Melbourne earlier this week, issues a statement mourning the 17-year-old and saying their thoughts are with the teammate involved in the incident.

title.children: Family mourns 'shining light' teenager who died after cricket accident

image.altText: A man in a black suit holds up his fist while standing in front of US and South Korean flags

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump says he has given South Korea approval to build a nuclear-powered submarine, a dramatic move that would admit Seoul to a small club of nations possessing such vessels.

title.children: Trump says South Korea has approval to build nuclear-powered submarine

image.altText: Kamala Harris looks at Joe Biden as he speaks from a presidential lectern.

props.synopsis: Richard Nixon did what Kamala Harris wants to. But for her to get to the White House, she is going to have to make tough decisions she has failed to in the past.

title.children: Joe Biden was exposed by his frailties. They're still exposing Kamala Harris

image.altText: The silhouette of a man at a laptop.

props.synopsis: Intelligence insider Peter Williams faces more than a decade in a US jail after pleading guilty to selling a Russian broker his employer's trade secrets.

title.children: US government blasts Australian who 'betrayed' country, sold Russia secrets

image.altText: Photo of Gus

props.synopsis: The dam has been previously searched by divers, but draining it will allow a "comprehensive visual search" to be completed, police say.

title.children: SA Police to drain dam in renewed search for missing 4yo Gus

image.altText: A composite image of signage of Australia's 'big four' banks ANZ, Westpac, the Commonwealth Bank and NAB signage

props.synopsis: A shock from the all-important consumer price index has left economists rewriting their rates outlooks, ahead of the Reserve Bank meeting next week.

title.children: Borrowers can expect one more rate cut, if they're lucky, bank economists predict

image.altText: A woman looks seriously at the camera

props.synopsis: The Domestic, Family and Sexual Violence Commission found systems meant to keep governments accountable are so fragmented they are leading to authorities passing the buck on responsibility.

title.children: National watchdog needed for violence against women, commissioner says

image.altText: Adeang and Albanese shake hands and smile inside the prime minister's office at parliament house.

props.synopsis: The federal government has refused to release a translation of an interview with Nauruan president David Adeang concerning a deal with Australia to deport hundreds of people, despite the Nauruan government publishing the video on Facebook.

title.children: Government withholds translated public interview about opaque Nauru deal

image.altText: A woman looks seriously down the barrel of a camera.

props.synopsis: A woman, who was unable to call triple-0 after men broke into her home while she was in her bedroom, is demanding answers from the telco as calls ramp up for a complete overhaul of the system.

title.children: Melbourne woman saw robber but could not call police using triple-0

image.altText: a woman standing in front of a christmas tree in a white dress

props.synopsis: A Brisbane bus driver charged over a crash that killed a teenager in the CBD has been found guilty of driving without due care causing death.

title.children: Bus driver spared jail time over crash that killed Brisbane teen

image.altText: An arrangement of 20 different sunscren products on a background of pink bathroom tiles.

props.synopsis: The Australian sunscreen manufacturer at the centre of a spate of recent product recalls has been blocked from exporting sunscreens to the United States for the past three years.

title.children: Sunscreen maker at centre of recalls blocked by US regulator for years

image.altText: Tim Ayres

props.synopsis: The government can't hide its frustration with Rio Tinto, but at the same time it's preparing to dip deeper into taxpayers' pockets to help the company out. Again.

title.children: Labor digging into taxpayers' pockets to bail out Rio Tinto again

image.altText: A worker in high-vis stands next to the interior of a ship hull showing crossbeams of metal.

props.synopsis: From wharfless ferries to bungled design specifications costing millions, the troubled Spirit of Tasmania ship replacement project saga just keeps rolling on.

title.children: How Tasmania's ferry operator made a multi-million-dollar mistake

image.altText: crypto atm scam victim Dorothy Dyall, Oct 2025

props.synopsis: A pensioner tells her nightmarish story as the financial crimes regulator takes action against a second Australian player in the booming crypto ATM business linked to lucrative scams and money laundering.

title.children: A computer alarm, scam calls, then Dorothy's life savings were gone

image.altText: Man in suit and sunglasses beside a woman in a suit jacket and pink shirt wearing sunglasses.

props.synopsis: A woman who used credit cards from the childcare centre where she worked to purchase personal clothes and cosmetics has been sentenced to jail.

title.children: Woman jailed for $300,000 childcare centre fraud

image.altText: NRL player running with the ball, passing to his left.

props.synopsis: Melbourne Storm premiership winner Ryan Papenhuyzen has been granted an immediate release from the club, with one year still remaining on his contract.

title.children: Papenhuyzen granted release from Storm to consider future amid R360 talk

image.altText: Childcare regulator

props.synopsis: Despite increasing rates of reporting over the last five years, few investigations have resulted in strong action by the NSW regulator.

title.children: Hundreds of accused childcare workers not punished by regulator

image.altText: A young woman with her five-year-old daughter, standing next to strewn debris and a damaged pink house.

props.synopsis: Hurricane Melissa, one of the strongest Atlantic hurricanes on record with top winds of 295 kilometres per hour, has left dozens dead across the Caribbean.

title.children: Hurricane Melissa devastates Caribbean and leaves dozens dead

image.altText: Mick Fetch stands in front of a fence with a sign reading "No Hunter Gas Pipeline,' near Maitland, October 2023.

props.synopsis: The NSW premier has warned farmers they may face compulsory land acquisition if they cannot reach a compromise with Santos on a multi-billion-dollar project at Narrabri.

title.children: Farmers condemn threat of compulsory land acquisition for gas project

image.altText: Lynda Henderson aged care

props.synopsis: With major changes to the aged care system looming this week, price hikes for older people accessing support at home could mean their aged care packages will not stretch as far.

title.children: Seniors risk losing some at-home services in Support at Home roll out

image.altText: A split image showing two dark-haired AFL players.

props.synopsis: Dion Prestia and Steven May are charged by police over their alleged involvement in a brawl in a Victorian coastal town last December.

title.children: AFL players charged over alleged involvement in Boxing Day brawl

image.altText: Donald Trump and Lee Jae Myung smile while shaking hands near a massive gold crown

props.synopsis: From menus featuring ketchup and American beef to the gifting of a massive replica gold crown, Donald Trump's visit to South Korea was carefully crafted to please the US president.

title.children: A gold crown, ketchup and the YMCA: Trump's warm welcome to South Korea

image.altText: Police vehicles parked near a green space that has been cordoned off with police tape.

props.synopsis: Dion Anthony Craig has been refused bail following the death of a 55-year-old woman at Ulmarra, NSW.

title.children: Man charged with murder after former policewoman killed in alleged hit-and-run

image.altText: A sign that reads Microsoft in white letters on a glass building.

props.synopsis: Microsoft says it is rolling out a fix to address an outage of its Azure cloud portal which left users unable to access Office 365, Minecraft and other services.

title.children: Microsoft deploys fix for Azure cloud service after outage

image.altText: A headshot of Drake, dressed in black on-stage.

props.synopsis: Superstar rapper Drake is appealing the dismissal of his defamation lawsuit against Universal Music Group over the Kendrick Lamar diss track Not Like Us.

title.children: Drake appeals defamation loss over Kendrick Lamar's Not Like Us

image.altText: Xi Jinping looks down as Donald Trump puts a hand on his arm in a room full of people.

props.synopsis: The meeting with US President Donald Trump and his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping is one of the most highly anticipated bilaterals of the year, as the leaders seek to strike a deal while also saving face.

title.children: As Trump and Xi prepare to talk trade, China will enter the room with a strong hand
